basic_info.description:
I'm Efaz Ibrahim, a passionate Software Engineer and Computer Science student at the University of South Florida, graduating in December 2025. I thrive at the intersection of backend systems, cloud technologies, and intuitive user interfaces, building solutions that are both scalable and impactful. I've gained hands-on experience through internships at Wells Fargo and USAA, where I built full-stack applications with innovative front ends and robust backends, integrated real-time dashboards, optimized deployment pipelines, and developed reusable UI components used enterprise-wide. My work has spanned Spring Boot, MongoDB, AWS, GCP, React, and Node.js, with a strong emphasis on performance optimization, automation, and clean architecture.

Beyond my professional experience, I enjoy taking on challenging projects, from creating an AI-powered trip planning tool to developing a cross-platform workout tracking app. I'm driven by curiosity, problem-solving, and the satisfaction of turning ideas into realityâ€”whether through enterprise solutions or innovative side projects.

When I'm not coding, I'm a regular at the gym, play a variety of sports, and enjoy traveling to explore new places and cultures.

projects.title: Animal Shelter
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
